reviewText: I think that Britney Spears is the best female artist since Madonna. Her style and songs keep on changing with the times and she really is turning out to be a younger version of Madonna! After the multi-million selling debut home video Time Out With Britney, she returned in December 2000 with Britney Spears: Live And More. This home video is jam-packed with all things Britney! From amazing concert performances in Hawaii, to massive instantly-worldwide recognisable music videos and exclusive interviews and surprises to TV skits, Britney Spears: Live And More really is essential for every Britney fan in the world...Britney Spears: Live And More begins with Britney's concert from May 2000 on Waikiki beach, Hawaii, USA to promote her epic second album Oops!...I Did It Again which has sold 21 million copies worldwide to date! Britney sings, dances and struts her stuff through massive worldwide hits such as (You Drive Me) Crazy, Oops!...I Did It Again, Sometimes, Born To Make You Happy, Don't Let Me Be The Last To Know, From The Bottom Of My Broken Heart and the finale for Britney's biggest hit ever, Baby One More Time! This amazing open-air concert showcases Britney's phenomenal dancing skills and her sweet voice. The 20,000 fans that pack the beach are so hyper and eccentric - they really are enjoying themselves! Earlier in 2000, Britney appeared on Saturday Night Live - America's top-rated comedy chat show. Not only did Britney appear on the show, she hosted the entire thing. The skits include Britney Hangs With Woodrow, where Britney hangs out with a man that lives in a sewer! There's also try-outs for her tour where Britney auditions lots of bad singers/dancers. But the best skit has to be Morning Latte. Britney stars as Dawn Paslowski and is dissing Britney left, right and centre! It really is funny. The humour is very American and because I'm British, I don't really find it all that amusing...but you just have to make an excuse for Britney, don't you?! Along with the concert in Hawaii, Britney gets to hang out with her dancers and check out the culture of the place, visit places of significant meaning to the residents of the land, pay surprise visits to schools (they nearly all faint!) and invite a girls' best mates around to her house to hang out with Britney for half an hour (believe me when I say I would do ANYTHING to hang with Britney for half an hour!). As if Live And More couldn't get any better, they throw in the full three music videos to Britney's massive hits Oops!...I Did It Again, Lucky and Stronger - all were taken from her huge second album Oops!...I Did It Again and all the videos are brilliant. I especially like the Oops!...I Did It Again video because it's set on Mars and Britney is like the Queen of the land in her slinky red catsuit as she seduces the object of her affection without breaking a sweat. The Lucky video follows a troubled female movie star. The lyrics, "If there's nothing missing in my life, then why do these tears come at night?" are very true to the video and maybe it's a personal reference to Britney's real life. The Stronger video is very dark and gothic even! No, that can't be! Britney? A goth? Not in my book, sister!OVERALL GRADE: 10/10All in all, Live And More is an essential video for all you Britney fans out there. If you don't have it, shame on you! And more importantly for the people who don't own it, why not?! Eh?! But seriously now, Live And More is one of Britney's best home videos to date out of Time Out With Britney, Britney: The Videos, Live From Las Vegas and Crossroads. But make sure you buy Live And More from Amazon.com now!
summary: Shame on the Britney fans who don't own this video!

reviewText: The first Britney Spears video was good, but this second Britney Spears video is great.  It is 80 minutes of pure Britney, and any fan of Ms. Spears will like that.Here is a run-down of everything on the video:1) Her televised FOX concert.  The hour-long show is included in full on this video.  I particularly like this perk on the video since our cable wasn't the best at the time this show was aired.2) Besides the FOX concert, you get to watch all the things Britney did while she was in Hawaii.  This includes things like dropping by a classroom to talk with kids or unexpectedly visiting her #1 fan in Hawaii.  You'll also get to watch Britney play with Dolphins, go water surfing, and perform the hula.  Oh, be still my beating heart.3) You get the music videos for "Oops...I Did It Again", "Stronger" and "Lucky."  A small portion of the MTV special "Making the Video" is included on this video for the "Oops...I Did It Again" video.4) A few of her Saturday Night Live skits are on this video.  One skit has her being serenaded by a homeless man in a sewer; another has Britney judging dancer tryouts (and if you look real close, Britney has to hide her stifled laughter on numerous occasions); and yet another skit (her best one, in my opinion) has her playing the part of Dawn Paslowski, sort of an anti-Britney who talks about the corrupt underbelly of the Mickey Mouse Club on the "Morning Latte" show.  Britney surprised me with this skit because she really had me believing she was this Paslowski girl.This is a great video; there's no other way to put it.  Any Britney fan should have this video (or the DVD, whichever you prefer) as part of their movie collection.  Even all those people out there who don't particularly like her should find something on this video worth viewing.By the way - Happy 20th Birthday to Britney AND me!  WOO-HOO!!
summary: Live and More -- What Else is There?
Title: N/A

reviewText: This DVD chronicles the entire `Oops I did it Again' Era and has music videos, live performances, outtakes, and SNL appearances from that famous 1999-2000 phase.Sadly, looking at this now only reminded me of how good an entertainer Britney really was. Love and marriage do weird things to people I guess, and Britney's downward trend began when she met and married Kevin Federline. Isn't it a shame when this happens to female singers? Whitney Houston signed her life away the day she met Bobby Brown and she still hasn't regained her former glory. The sad part is, Britney is actually a gifted entertainer. Like Madonna, she has no perceivable skills to speak of, except for her moderately good looks. However, when you use that in conjunction with above-average dancing and some killer pop tunes, you have magic, as we can witness on this DVD.My favorite portions of this include her infamous SNL appearance as a former Mousketeer and she disses herself (should be seen to be believed). And then there those amazingly energetic dance moves and performances she became legendary for. The best on this is for `The Beat Goes On', a cover of the Sonny and Cher song, and subsequent versions of `Oops' itself. In fact, the videos for Oops and `Stronger' are included alongwith this fantabulous package.Of all the Britney DVDs out there, this by FAR has the most content. In fact you can let it play and it just goes on and on, and is never boring. If you were a fan of Spears during the Oops Era, this DVD has everything you could possibly want. Its full of stuff, believe me, unlike so many of her other DVDs that were low on content and extras. Right now, its second to her Greatest Hits DVD, which cant be beat, for obvious reasons.Must-Buy.
summary: Britney's Second Best DVD - Packed full of Goodies
Title: N/A

reviewText: I'll admit it.  I'm a big fan of Britney Spears!  It happened from taking my daughter to see Britney's 2000 concert tour (upon which this DVD is based), and from listening to Britney's CD's (and my daughter's other favorite artists) on various driving vacations taken over the last few years with my family.  (Needless to say, I'm also a fan of 'N Sync, the Backstreet Boys and Christina Aguilera.)Even though I bought this DVD as a birthday present for my daughter, I find myself watching and listening to it as much as she does.  And since I had just acquired a new DVD player, I was also looking for an excuse to teach my (very tech-savvy) daughter how to use it.She and I both love this DVD.  She loves the vignettes of Britney playing with dolphins and learning how to hula.  We enjoy the Saturday Night Live episodes that Britney hosted, the best segment being a skit entitled, "Britney Judges Dance Tryouts" which parodies her songs, "Oops I Did It Again," and "...Baby One More Time" in a manner which leaves my entire family in stitches.But, of course, we both love the music.  (For me, being a big dance music fan, Britney is simply this generation's standard bearer taking over for Madonna, Janet Jackson and Paula Abdul in both tunes and actions.  Britney's ballads are also good too.)My daughter and I especially like the video jukebox which allows us to arrange the concert songs and music videos in our own customized sets for playing.  My daughter has her own favorite mix, but I always order the songs with "You Drive Me Crazy" in the beginning (which is the concert's opening song), with "Sometimes" (my favorite), "Lucky," and "Don't Let Me Be The Last To Know" in the middle, finishing with "Stronger," "Born To Make You Happy" and, at last, "...Baby One More Time" (which is the concert's closing number).  The production of each live performance video was well edited using a variety of camera angles to capture the dancing (which was outstanding), the audience interaction, the stunning Waikiki beach setting, and, of course, Britney in all of her youthful beauty.  Watching this DVD was like having the best seat in the house, and it rekindles for my daugher and I the fun we had as a family at Britney's concert.(I normally enjoy my customized set by wearing my cordless 900 mhz stereo headphones, turning off the TV's speakers, and listening to the music while I work or lounge around the house as if I were using a Walkman -- except I can choose which songs to listen to and in what order.  I listen to CD's in my DVD player the same way.  Isn't technology wonderful?)Britney's "Live and More!" DVD is a must own for any Britney Spears fan as it will provide hours of listening -- and viewing -- enjoyment?  Buy it for your daughter (or niece or grand daughter).  But don't be surprised -- if you like it too!
summary: Oops, I Listened To It Again, and Again, and Again!

reviewText: I subtracted a star because I wanted more personal interviews on the DVD. Spears has 'fun' times with friends and surprise a fan situation but I would have liked to of heard more from her.I potentially minused .5 star because I don't think this DVD is LIVE. More like some of it lip-synched. But I can't say that I didn't expect that, as the majority of the artists seem to do that.I absolutely love the SNL skits. My favorite ones are the scouting for dancers. As well as the Morning Latte. They are just too hilarious to pass up!!Overall entertaining and fun concert/DVD. And I recommend it, at least to rent, if you enjoy concerts and music.

reviewText: I got this DVD as a birthday gift, and I really enjoyed. As a britney true fan, none of the material included in the DVD was new to me. The biggest advantage of buying this is the high quality of image and sound.The DVD presents FOX TV special, with a britney concert in Waikiki beach. It's kind of cool, but I can assure you that britney concerts of "oops world tour" are much better than that. Actually, I saw her live in Rock in Rio and I hope JIVE releases that particular show in DVD, so that all fans around the world can enjoy one of her best performances ever.Coming back to the DVD. It also brings the videos for "oops!...I did it again", "Lucky' and "Stronger". I missed "Don't let me be the last to know" video. Unfortunaltely, the video debuted after this DVD release and could not be included in it.Finally, the DVD also presents britney as a host of SNL. You can enjoy her performances on that show as well. I wish that all those people who affirm britney only does playback and cannot sing watch her performance of "Don't let me be..." at saturday night live. Her voice is great!If you are a britney fan, this is a DVD you should buy.
summary: a must have for britney fans

reviewText: This is a great DVD, with all of her sultry music-videos. Britney's at it, again. She's so graceful and very talented on stage. She can dance with the best of 'em. However, her acting skills are another story: There's a shoddy "SNL" skit of her on "Live and More!" smoking a cigarette. (Good job, Britney. It's nice to know you're setting an example for our young people by "lighting-up.") The music videos on this DVD are awesome, nonetheless! Some of the scenes were filmed on location, at the beautiful sun-kissed beaches in and around Honolulu, Hawaii and Waikiki Beach. There's a little bit of serendipity going on, when Britney goes to this young girls house (w/ camera crews in-tow), to pleasantly surprising one of her biggest fans at her house on the island. She knocks at the door, and there she is. It was so gratifying to see the smile on this starstruck girl's face, boisterously jumping up and down. She was so excited to see one of her favorite idols. Meanwhile, she's calling every one of her friends to invite them over, for this "once in a lifetime" opportunity to get to hang-out with Britney. They all had their picture taken with the "sexy diva," and recieved these autographs from her. Bottom line: Great performances of Britney and Company. Other than that, she's so out of place in the realm of being an actress. She ought to take some acting lessons from Madonna, that way she'll be able to "make-it-to-the-top" someday. Perhaps, she'll maybe land a co-starring role in a suspenceful, erotic-thriller with the likes of Collin Farrel or Justin Guarrini from "American Idol." (If she ever got with Justin, it would make me want to puke. The dude reminds me of Sideshow Bob, from "The Simpsons." LOL!) All things considered: I give Britney Spears - "Live and More!" ***4-stars***.
summary: Great DVD, with all her music videos.
